intro: Van-royena, commonly known as the royal fern, is a striking plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its large, feathery fronds that can reach several feet in length. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, allowing it to spread and form dense colonies. Its leaves are typically bioluminescent under certain conditions, adding a unique visual appeal. Van-royena thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid rainforests.
